thread.title: Gosselin: I expect Charlie Strong back at UT in 2016
thread.title_full: Gosselin: I expect Charlie Strong back at UT in 2016 | Dallas Morning News

author: Rick Gosselin
title: Gosselin: I expect Charlie Strong back at UT in 2016
text:
Columnist Rick Gosselin held a chat on Monday and answered a couple of questions about the Texas Longhorns. Here are some highlights.
Does Charlie Strong survive to coach next year at UT if they finish with 4 or 5 wins this year, which looks to be a definite possibility?
Gosselin: "Unless the new AD, whomever it is, decides he wants to bring in his own guy, I think Charlie is back. There was a strong financial commitment to him and I don't think you can judge him until after four years when he has overhauled the roster with his own recruits. Strong is a good football coach. He proved that at Louisville. And I think he can be a good coach at Texas. But he had Teddy Bridgewater at Louisville. He's now winning games in the NFL. If Jerrod Heard is the answer at quarterback, the Longhorns are on their way back. If he's not the answer, Strong has two years left to find one."
The Cowboys won but lost a QB. The Longhorns won but found a QB. Who is in a better place?
Gosselin: "At this point, the Longhorns. If you don't have a quarterback, at any level of football, you don't have a chance. If, in fact, Heard is the answer."
Click here for the full chat.
